thread.title: REPORT: Homeland Security Disputes Threat Posed By Citizens of Travel Ban Countries
thread.title_full: REPORT: Homeland Security Disputes Threat Posed By Citizens of Travel Ban Countries

author: Justin Baragona
title: REPORT: Homeland Security Disputes Threat Posed By Citizens of Travel Ban Countries
text:
REPORT: Homeland Security Disputes Threat Posed By Citizens of Travel Ban Countries by Justin Baragona | 5:00 pm, February 24th, 2017 
It was reported earlier by CNN that the White House had assigned the Department of Homeland Security with the task of building a legal case for its travel ban impacting seven Mulism-majority countries. 
Well, it appears that Homeland Security isn’t giving President Donald Trump what he’s looking for, per the Associated Press. BREAKING: Homeland Security intelligence report disputes threat posed by citizens of 7 nations in Trump travel ban. 
— The Associated Press (@AP) February 24, 2017 
The travel ban executive order was held up by a federal judge earlier this month and that stay was upheld by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals. 
[image via screengrab]
